revised_title: Explaining the Zollner-Judd Class of Geometrical Illusions through Spatial Filtering and Spatial Primitives in Early Vision
tldr: The authors investigated the Zollner and Judd class of geometrical illusions, which affect the apparent length and orientation of lines when they abut against oblique lines. They found that the length and orientation biases are geometrically related and depend on the same underlying mechanism. The study provides evidence for cross-orientation inhibition and offers a comprehensive explanation for both the orientation and length effects in these illusions.
